page.title: 05STYDD HALL AND CHAPEL RUINS
page.content: One day we went for a walk down the fields to Stydd. Stydd was built in the twelfth century. There is the ruins of a chapel at Stydd. It used to be called St. Mary and St. John the Baptist. It was a Benedictine hermitage. It was given to the Knights Hospitallers and became a Preceptory. Only one wall of the chapel is left. Next to the chapel there are old tomb stones. Knights were buried inside them. There is an old font next to the chapel as well. Next to the ruins is Stydd Hall. This was an Elizabethan mansion. It is still occupied as a farmhouse. It is in need of restoration and repair. Stydd used to be a separate Township but now it is just the ruins, the Hall and farm.
